item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "My soul is an empty carousel at sunset." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "My soul knows my meat is doing bad things, and is embarrassed. But my meat just keeps right on doing bad, dumb things." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Hilary Mantel
item.description: "When it was time to write, and he took his pen in his hand, he never thought of consequences; he thought of style. I wonder why I ever bothered with sex, he thought; there's nothing in this breathing world so gratifying as an artfully placed semicolon." -- Hilary Mantel

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "Wasn't writing a kind of soaring, an achievable form of flight, of fancy, of the imagination?" -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "She lay in the dark and knew everything." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I'm going to go home. Everything is going to be normal again. Boring again. Wonderful again." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "The map is not the territory." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A mystery is solved with a story." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "I won't say she was silly, but I think one of us was silly, and it wasn't me!" -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: Rachel add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Let us have the luxury of silence." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "I want you to believe...to believe in things that you cannot." -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description:
"Dr. Watson's summary list of Sherlock Holmes's strengths and weaknesses:
"1. Knowledge of Literature: Nil. 2. Knowledge of Philosophy: Nil. 3. Knowledge of Astronomy: Nil. 4. Knowledge of Politics: Feeble. 5. Knowledge of Botany: Variable. Well up in belladonna, opium, and poisons generally. Knows nothing of practical gardening. 6. Knowledge of Geology: Practical but limited. Tells at a glance different soils from each other. After walks has shown me splashes upon his trousers, and told me by their colour and consistence in what part of London he had received them. 7. Knowledge of Chemistry: Profound. 8. Knowledge of Anatomy: Accurate but unsystematic. 9. Knowledge of Sensational Literature: Immense. He appears to know every detail of every horror perpetrated in the century. 10. Plays the violin well. 11. Is an expert singlestick player, boxer, and swordsman. 12. Has a good practical knowledge of British law." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "You know my methods. Apply them." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "beshawled, bediamonded women" -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It might have driven me mad; but I was always a pretty stubborn one, so I just held on and bided my time." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is one of life's bitterest truths that bedtime so often arrives just when things are really getting interesting." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And so it goes..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I hate to hear you talk about all women as if they were fine ladies instead of rational creatures. None of us want to be in calm waters all our lives." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Emily Brontë
item.description: "I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free." -- Emily Brontë

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Little by little, one travels far" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For still there are so many things that I have never seen: in every wood in every spring there is a different green." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
